programs.name: Assistance Dog Special Allowance (ADSA)
programs.summary: ADSA provides certain people who use a guide, signal, or service dog with a monthly payment to help with their disability-related needs.

programs.name: CalFresh
programs.summary: CalFresh provides monthly food benefits to certain low-income individuals and families.

programs.name: California Work Opportunity and Responsibility to Kids (CalWORKs)
programs.summary: CalWORKs provides cash aid and services to certain low-income families with children in the home.

programs.name: Cash Assistance Program for Immigrants (CAPI)
programs.summary: CAPI provides monthly cash benefits to certain elderly, blind, or disabled legal immigrants.

programs.name: California Alternate Rates for Energy (CARE)
programs.summary: CARE provides a discount on electricity and natural gas bills for certain low-income individuals and families.

programs.name: Family Electric Rate Assistance (FERA)
programs.summary: FERA provides a discount on electricity bills for certain low-income families.

programs.name: VA Disability Compensation
programs.summary: VA disability compensation provides a monthly payment to certain injured or disabled veterans.

programs.name: General Assistance (GA)
programs.summary: GA provides cash assistance and employment services to certain low-income individuals with no dependent children.

programs.name: No-Fee ID Card
programs.summary: Unhoused or elderly individuals may get an identification card from the Department of Motor Vehicles without having to pay the usual fee.

programs.name: Reduced Fee ID Card
programs.summary: Low-income individuals may get a discount on the fee for an identification card from the Department of Motor Vehicles.

programs.name: In-Home Supportive Services (IHSS)
programs.summary: IHSS provides in-home personal assistance to certain low-income individuals who are blind, disabled, or elderly so they can continue to live at home safely.

programs.name: California LifeLine
programs.summary: Lifeline provides a discount on home phone and cell phone bills for certain low-income households.  In some situations, the program will cover the full cost of phone bills and provide a new phone for free.

programs.name: Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP)
programs.summary: LIHEAP provides one-time assistance with paying energy bills, home weatherization, and energy-related home repairs to certain low-income households.

programs.name: VTA ACCESS Paratransit
programs.summary: VTA ACCESS Paratransit provides door-to-door transportation service as well as free VTA bus and light rail transit passes for certain disabled individuals.

programs.name: Housing Choice & Property Voucher Interest Lists
programs.summary: The Housing Choice Voucher and Property Voucher programs help certain low-income individuals and families pay for rental housing. This was previously known as the "Section 8 Program."  Eligible individuals will be added to a Housing Choice Voucher interest list and then optionally to a Property Voucher list to await random selection into a separate voucher waiting list when it reopens.

programs.name: Supplemental Security Income (SSI)
programs.summary: SSI is a federal program that provides a monthly cash benefit to certain low-income individuals who are disabled, blind, or elderly.

programs.name: Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI)
programs.summary: SSDI is a federal program that provides a monthly cash benefit to certain disabled individuals who have worked and paid Social Security taxes in the past.

programs.name: VA Pension
programs.summary: VA Pension is a program that provides ongoing cash payments for eligible veterans.

programs.name: Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC)
programs.summary: WIC is a health and nutrition family for mothers and their children that provides education, support, and benefits to buy healthy foods.

programs.name: Clipper START
programs.summary: Clipper START provides discounted single ride transit fares for qualifying individuals. Applicable services include VTA, Caltrain, BART, and many more.

programs.name: Homelessness Prevention System
programs.summary: The Homelessness Prevention System provides services to certain individuals and families at risk of homelessness, including financial assistance, legal services, and case management.

programs.name: Housing and Urban Development Veterans Affairs Supportive Housing (HUD-VASH)
programs.summary: HUD-VASH provides housing vouchers and supportive services to certain homeless veterans and their families.
